panels.description: CPU usage by user (not system) per core
panels.title: CPU user usage rate
CPU usage core avg by mode

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.description: Prometheus scrape duration measures the total HTTP request time from the caller. This internal scrape time is the total time to collect metrics
panels.title: Lodestar internal scrape duration

panels.description: Percent of attestations having correct head.
panels.title: Wrong head ratio

panels.description: Min delay from when the validator should send an object and when it was received
panels.title: Prev epoch min delay
Attestater sent per epoch per validator

options.content: Verifies signature sets in a thread pool of workers. Must ensure that signatures are verified fast and efficiently.

panels.description: Utilization rate = total CPU time per worker per second. Graph is stacked. This ratios should be high since BLS verification is the limiting factor in the node's throughput.
panels.title: BLS thread pool - utilization rate

panels.description: Raw throughput of the thread pool. How many individual signature sets are successfully validated per second
panels.title: BLS thread pool - sig sets / sec

panels.description: Average sync time to validate a single signature set. Note that the set may have been verified in batch. In most normal hardware this value should be ~1-2ms
panels.title: BLS thread pool - sig set verification time / set

panels.description: How much async time job spent waiting in the job queue before being picked up. This number should be really low <100ms to ensure signatures are validated fast.
panels.title: BLS thread pool - job wait time

panels.description: Total length of the job queue. Note: this queue is not bounded
panels.title: BLS thread pool - queue length

panels.description: What percentage of total signature sets were verified in batch, which is an optimization to reduce verification costs by x2. For a synced node this should be ~100%
panels.title: BLS thread pool - % of sigs verified in batch

panels.description: How many signature set batches fail per second. On failure all signatures in the batch have to be verified twice, so this number should be very low to make the optimization worth it.
panels.title: BLS thread pool - batch retries / sec

panels.description: How many individual signature sets are invalid vs (valid + invalid). We don't control this number since peers may send us invalid signatures. This number should be very low since we should ban bad peers. If it's too high the batch optimization may not be worth it.
panels.title: BLS thread pool - sig error rate

panels.description: Async time from sending a message to the worker and the worker receiving it.
panels.title: BLS worker pool - to from worker latency

panels.description: Average sets per job. A set may contain +1 signatures. This number should be higher than 1 to reduce communication costs
panels.title: BLS worker pool - sets per job

panels.description:
Average signatures per set. This number is decided by the time of object submitted to the pool:
- Sync blocks: 128
- Aggregates: 3
- Attestations: 1
panels.title: BLS worker pool - sigs per set
Block processor queue - Job wait time
ratio of updateHead() calls that change head
Gossip validation queue - Processed jobs / slot
Gossip validation queues - Job wait time

panels.description: Time elappsed between block slot time and the time block received via gossip
panels.title: Gossip Block Received Delay

panels.description: Time elappsed between block slot time and the time block received via gossip
panels.title: Gossip Block process time
Requested peers to connect and disconnect
Peer count per gossip score threshold
Not dropped rate of useful ENRs
Useful ENRs rate vs all seen ENRs
Call rate per slot (grouped by entrypoint)
Call rate per slot (grouped by caller)
Regen job avg time (grouped by entrypoint)
Regen job avg time (grouped by caller)
Total peers in sync chains by type

panels.description:
Cache Hit Count: number of state cache hit
Waste Count: number of state that's not used
panels.title: Hit vs Waste
